SSP v0.5, which is a web-based interface for Session Setup Protocol (SSP), has two main phases: WebUI Integration and Session Visualization Phase.

**WebUI Integration Phase:**
In this phase, SSP v0.5 integrates its functionality with the web user interface (WebUI). This involves developing a user-friendly interface that allows users to configure and manage their network settings, such as setting up new networks or modifying existing ones. The WebUI will also provide real-time feedback on the status of the network and any errors that may occur during the setup process.

**Session Visualization Phase:**
In this phase, SSP v0.5 visualizes the session setup process in a graphical manner. This allows users to see how their networks are being set up and configured in real-time. The visualization will provide an intuitive way for users to understand complex network concepts, such as IP addresses, subnet masks, and gateway settings.

By integrating these two phases, SSP v0.5 aims to simplify the process of setting up and managing networks, making it more accessible to a wider range of users.

I hope this information is helpful! If you have any further questions or need more clarification, feel free to ask.
